section.name: Building Commons Collections
section.p: Commons Collections uses Ant as its primary build system, however Maven is used for site generation.
You may also be interested in the v3.2.1 release notes.

section.name: Ant Goals
section.p: To build a jar file, change into Collection's root directory and run "ant jar". The result will be in the "build" subdirectory.
All tests can be run with "ant test". A single test can be run with "ant -Dtestcase=org.apache.commons.collections.TestXxx test".
To build the Javadocs, run "ant javadoc". The result will be in "build/docs/apidocs".

section.name: Maven 2 Goals
section.p: The following Maven 2 commands can be used to build collections:

ul.li: mvn test - compile and run the unit tests
mvn install - build the jar and install in local maven repository
mvn site assembly:assembly - Create the source and binary distributions

section.name: Maven 1 Goals
section.p: The following Maven 1 commands can be used to build collections:

ul.li: maven test - compile and run the unit tests
maven dist - Create the source and binary distributions

section.name: Ant Goals
section.p: The following Ant commands can be used to build collections:

ul.li: ant test - compile and run the unit tests
ant dist - Create the source and binary distributions
